intro: Pavonia discolor, commonly known as the white woodflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer, and its heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Pavonia discolor is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
